concept.title: Command Options
concept.shortdesc: Options are single keywords. Commands that accept options use an options block, delimited by square brackets, which comes after the command. The options block can accept one or more options, separated by a comma.

example.p: Commands that accept options can have an options block with just a single option.
Commands that accept options can have an options block with multiple options separated by a comma.

link.desc: Commands can accept parameters. Collections of parameters that change the behavior of the command are setups. Setups come after the command in blocks, delimited into blocks by square brackets.
